sections.section_title: Short title, extent and commencement
sections.body: (1) This Act may be called the Official Trustees Act, 1913. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force on such date as the Federal Government, by notification in the official Gazette, may direct.

sections.section_title: Interpretation Clause
sections.body: In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, 'Government' or 'the Government' means in relation to any Province, the Provincial Government.

sections.section_title: Extent of jurisdiction of High Courts
sections.body: For the purposes of this Act the High Court shall have jurisdiction throughout the Province.

chapters.chapter_title: Part II The Office of Official Trustee

sections.section_title: Official Trustees
sections.body: (1) The Provincial Government for each Province shall appoint an Official Trustee. (2) No person shall be appointed to the office of Official Trustee who is not an advocate practising in a High Court or a person already in the service of the State.

sections.section_title: Appointment and powers of Deputy Official Trustees
sections.body: The Government may appoint a Deputy or Deputies to assist the Official Trustee; and any Deputy so appointed shall, subject to the control of the Government and the general or special orders of the Official Trustee, be competent to discharge any of the duties and exercise any of the powers of the Official Trustee.

sections.section_title: Official Trustee to be corporation sole to have perpetual succession and official seal, and to sue and be sued in his corporate name
sections.body: The Official Trustee shall be a corporation sole by the name of the Official Trustee of the Province for which he is appointed and, as such Official Trustee, shall have perpetual succession and an official seal, and may sue and be sued in his corporate name.

chapters.chapter_title: Part III Rights, Powers, Duties and Liabilities of Official Trustee

sections.section_title: General powers and duties of official Trustee
sections.body: (1) Subject to, and in accordance with, the provisions of this Act and the rules made thereunder, the Official Trustee may, if he thinks fit, act as an ordinary trustee. (2) The Official Trustee shall have the same powers, duties and liabilities and be entitled to the same rights and privileges and be subject to the same control and orders of the Court as any other trustee acting in the same capacity.

sections.section_title: Official Trustee may with consent be appointed trustee of settlement by grantor
sections.body: (1) Any person intending to create a trust may by the instrument creating the trust and with the consent of the Official Trustee, appoint him to be the trustee of the property subject to such trust.

sections.section_title: Appointment of Official Trustee as trustee by will
sections.body: When the Official Trustee has been appointed trustee under any will, the executor of the will shall notify the contents of such will to such Official Trustee.

sections.section_title: Power of High Court to appoint Official Trustee to be trustee of property
sections.body: (1) If any property is subject to a trust and there is no trustee within the local limits of the High Court willing or capable to act in the trust, the High Court may on application make an order for the appointment of the Official Trustee.

sections.section_title: Power of private trustees to appoint official Trustee to be trustee of property
sections.body: (1) If any property is subject to a trust and all the trustees are desirous that the Official Trustee shall be appointed, it shall be lawful for such trustees to appoint the Official Trustee.

sections.section_title: Executor or administrator may pay to Official Trustee legacy share etc. of infant or lunatic
sections.body: (1) If any infant or lunatic is entitled to any gift, legacy or share of the assets of a deceased person, it shall be lawful for the executor or administrator to pay such legacy to the Official Trustee.

sections.section_title: Auditors to be appointed to examine official Trustee’s accounts etc., and to report to Government
sections.body: Auditors shall be appointed to examine the accounts of the Official Trustee.

sections.section_title: Auditor’s power to summon witnesses and to call for documents
sections.body: Auditors shall have the power to summon witnesses and call for documents.

sections.section_title: Right of beneficiary to inspection and copies of accounts
sections.body: Beneficiaries shall have the right to inspect and obtain copies of accounts.

sections.section_title: Power of High Court to make orders in respect of property vested in Official Trustee
sections.body: The High Court may make orders regarding property vested in the Official Trustee.

sections.section_title: Order of Court to have effect of a decree
sections.body: Orders of the Court shall have the effect of a decree.
